info.name: Central sulcus (of Rolando)
info.description: The central sulcus (of Rolando) is an important sulcus on the lateral aspect of the cerebral hemisphere that separates the frontal from the parietal lobes. It extends from just medial to the superior border of the hemisphere downward to the lateral or Sylvian fissure. The primary motor and somatosensory areas of cortex form the gyri (pre-central and post-central, respectively) on either side of this sulcus.
